gs_estp(e);});</script></div></div><div id="gs_ccl_results"> <div class="gs_r"><div class="gs_ggs gs_fl"><div class="gs_ggsm" id="gs_ggsW0"><div class="gs_ggsd"><a class="gs_ctc"><span class="gs_ct1">[BOOK]</span><span class="gs_ct2">[B]</span></span> <a data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;ct=res&amp;cd=0&amp;ei=YLOYWf2oMIH5jAGOoaHYBQ&amp;scisig=AAGBfm2ngxj4leFnIlnxICl8qP23a_CBKw&amp;nossl=1" software</a></h3><div class="gs_a"><a href="/citations?user=-eEBWnYAAAAJ&amp;hl=en&amp;oi=sra">CM Kelty</a> - 2008 - books.google.com</div><div class="gs_rs">In Two Bits, Christopher M. Kelty investigates the history and cultural significance of Free <br/>Software, revealing the people and practices that have transformed not only software but <br/>also music, film, science, and education. 2013 - books.google.com</div><div class="gs_rs">The internet has recently grown from a fringe cultural phenomenon to a significant site of <br/>cultural production and transformation. Internet Culture maps this new domain of language, <br/>politics and identity, locating it within the histories of communication and the public sphere. <br/></div><div class="gs_fl"><a href="http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/pdf/10.1177/1357034X95001003005">Postmodern virtualities</a></h3><div class="gs_a">M Poster - Body &amp; Society, 1995 - journals.sagepub.com</div><div class="gs_rs">On the eve of the 21st century there have been two innovative discussions about the general <br/>conditions of life: one concerns a possible postmodern'culture and even society; the other <br/>concerns broad, massive changes in communications systems. spatial practices of mobile workershow mobile workers <br/>manage their use of technology and place. id="gs_rt_hdr"><h2><a href="/scholar?cluster=15145583096793820564&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5">Leviathan and the Air-Pump: Hobbes, Boyle, and the Experimental Life (New in data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;oi=gga&amp;ct=gga&amp;cd=0&amp;ei=cbOYWdPgJcaAjAGT54qYAw&amp;scisig=AAGBfm3N9UawHX7pRRiDS8Edz0qS6odF1g&amp;nossl=1" 14.139.206.50</a></div></div></div><div class="gs_ri"><h3 class="gs_rt"><span class="gs_ctc"><span class="gs_ct1">[BOOK]</span><span class="gs_ct2">[B]</span></span> <a data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;ct=res&amp;cd=0&amp;ei=cbOYWdPgJcaAjAGT54qYAw&amp;scisig=AAGBfm3L8nieI-mCirSduB5VGqdn4oE0pA&amp;nossl=1" href="https://books.google.com/books?hl=en&amp;lr=&amp;id=CWnABgAAQBAJ&amp;oi=fnd&amp;pg=PP1&amp;ots=a8BMFoB9ky&amp;sig=r5EpugC7zTR45PIsq2Pvoh-MLow">Social linguistics and literacies: Ideology in discourses</a></h3><div class="gs_a"><a href="/citations?user=fU8fmEIAAAAJ&amp;hl=en&amp;oi=sra">J Gee</a> - 2015 - books.google.com</div><div class="gs_rs">In its first edition, Social Linguistics and Literacies was a major contribution to the emerging <br/>interdisciplinary field of sociocultural approaches to language and literacy, and was one of <br/>the founding texts of the 'New Literacy Studies'. href="http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0735275114536896">Sound on Sound: Situating Interaction in Sonic Object Settings</a></h3><div class="gs_a"><a href="/citations?user=8MMOejwAAAAJ&amp;hl=en&amp;oi=sra">J Klett</a> - Sociological Theory, 2014 - journals.sagepub.com</div><div class="gs_rs">Sociologists have yet to theorize interactions with sonic materiality. In this article I introduce <br/>an analytical concept for the observation of interactions with sound. Sound has material <br/>effects in all situations. But the audibility of sonic objects is a relation of situated actors to <br/></div><div class="gs_fl"><a href="/scholar?cites=4682140301799643922&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5&amp;hl=en">Cited by 10</a> <a href="/scholar?q=related:EttOJcxN-kAJ:scholar.google.com/&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5">Related articles</a> <a class="gs_nph" href="/scholar?cluster=4682140301799643922&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5">All 5 versions</a> <a aria-controls="gs_cit" aria-haspopup="true" class="gs_nph" href="#" onclick="return gs_ocit(event,'EttOJcxN-kAJ','7')" role="button">Cite</a> <span class="gs_nph"><a href="#" id="gs_svl7" onclick="return gs_sva('EttOJcxN-kAJ','7')" title="Save this article to my library so that I can read or cite it later.">Save</a><span class="gs_svm" id="gs_svo7">Saving<span id="gs_svd7">...</span></span><a id="gs_svs7" style="display:none">Saved</a><span class="gs_svm" id="gs_sve7">Error saving. <a href="#" onclick="return gs_sva('EttOJcxN-kAJ','7')">Try again?</a></span></span> <a class="gs_mor gs_oph" href="#" onclick="return gs_more(this,1)" role="button">More</a> <a class="gs_nvi" href="#" onclick="return gs_more(this,0)" role="button">Fewer</a></div></div></div> <div class="gs_r"><div class="gs_ri"><h3 class="gs_rt"><span class="gs_ctc"><span class="gs_ct1">[BOOK]</span><span class="gs_ct2">[B]</span></span> <a data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;ct=res&amp;cd=8&amp;ei=d7OYWe-gAcGx2Aa0sY2YDQ&amp;scisig=AAGBfm2EI3uhEBKn9diEEZebj2YI4eYllQ&amp;nossl=1" href="https://books.google.com/books?hl=en&amp;lr=&amp;id=xDIZCgAAQBAJ&amp;oi=fnd&amp;pg=PR11&amp;ots=I0BmN4W5mC&amp;sig=2tPOt0Wpz3zJrhkP7qan63Lo2Ts">Radio and the Gendered Soundscape: Women and Broadcasting in Argentina and Uruguay, 19301950</a></h3><div class="gs_a">C Ehrick - 2015 - books.google.com</div><div class="gs_rs">This book is a history of women, radio, and the gendered constructions of voice and sound <br/>in Buenos Aires, Argentina, and Montevideo, Uruguay. href="http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0265659010368750">Young people with specific language impairment: A review of social and emotional functioning in adolescence</a></h3><div class="gs_a">K Durkin, <a href="/citations?user=_fKi6BEAAAAJ&amp;hl=en&amp;oi=sra">G Conti-Ramsden</a> - Child Language Teaching and  , 2010 - journals.sagepub.com</div><div class="gs_rs">This article provides a review of research into the social and emotional functioning of <br/>adolescents with specific language impairment (SLI). In particular, we focus on peer <br/>relations, peer friendships, bullying, emotional difficulties and psychiatric difficulties. id="gs_rt_hdr"><h2><a href="/scholar?cluster=9018131041311348870&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5">New materialism as media theory: Medianatures and dirty matter</a></h2><div style="margin:0.5em 0 1.5em 0"><a class="gs_in_cb" href="javascript:void(0)" id="gs_scipsc" role="checkbox"><span class="gs_lbl">Search within citing articles</span><span class="gs_chk"></span><span class="gs_cbx"></span></a></div><script>gs_evt(gs_id("gs_scipsc"),"click",function(e){var gs_estp(e);});</script></div></div><div id="gs_ccl_results"> <div class="gs_r"><div class="gs_ri"><h3 class="gs_rt"><span class="gs_ctc"><span class="gs_ct1">[BOOK]</span><span class="gs_ct2">[B]</span></span> <a data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;ct=res&amp;cd=0&amp;ei=grOYWe3-IoSD2Abotaf4DA&amp;scisig=AAGBfm0NM3rnGgrXfJ9wL5tsxWKPB9NZTA&amp;nossl=1" href="https://books.google.com/books?hl=en&amp;lr=&amp;id=lYwcAgAAQBAJ&amp;oi=fnd&amp;pg=PP6&amp;ots=Dxr99F4jCZ&amp;sig=Mp-s_bXcpGm2yyWcLm6OmvQSZWc">Collaborative media: production, consumption, and design interventions</a></h3><div class="gs_a"><a href="/citations?user=wBPvZE0AAAAJ&amp;hl=en&amp;oi=sra">J Lwgren</a>, B Reimer - 2013 - books.google.com</div><div class="gs_rs">With many new forms of digital media--including such popular social media as Facebook, <br/>Twitter, and Flickr--the people formerly known as the audience no longer only consume but <br/>also produce and even design media. Jonas Lwgren and Bo Reimer term this <br/></div><div class="gs_fl"><a href="/scholar?cites=4318368531278692641&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5&amp;hl=en">Cited by 40</a> <a href="/scholar?q=related:IYEXrEzt7TsJ:scholar.google.com/&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5">Related articles</a> <a class="gs_nph" href="/scholar?cluster=4318368531278692641&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5">All 5 versions</a> <a aria-controls="gs_cit" aria-haspopup="true" class="gs_nph" href="#" onclick="return gs_ocit(event,'IYEXrEzt7TsJ','0')" role="button">Cite</a> <span class="gs_nph"><a href="#" id="gs_svl0" onclick="return gs_sva('IYEXrEzt7TsJ','0')" title="Save this article to my library so that I can read or cite it later.">Save</a><span class="gs_svm" id="gs_svo0">Saving<span id="gs_svd0">...</span></span><a id="gs_svs0" style="display:none">Saved</a><span class="gs_svm" id="gs_sve0">Error saving. <a href="#" onclick="return gs_sva('IYEXrEzt7TsJ','0')">Try again?</a></span></span> <a class="gs_mor" href="#" onclick="return gs_more(this,1)" role="button">More</a> <a class="gs_nvi" href="http://scholar.google.com/scholar?output=instlink&amp;nossl=1&amp;q=info:IYEXrEzt7TsJ:scholar.google.com/&amp;hl=en&amp;as_sdt=2005&amp;sciodt=0,5&amp;scillfp=14391246303705546131&amp;oi=llo">Library Search</a> <a class="gs_nvi" href="#" onclick="return gs_more(this,0)" role="button">Fewer</a></div></div></div> <div class="gs_r"><div class="gs_ggs gs_fl"><div class="gs_ggsm" id="gs_ggsW1"><div class="gs_ggsd"><a data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;oi=gga&amp;ct=gga&amp;cd=1&amp;ei=grOYWe3-IoSD2Abotaf4DA&amp;scisig=AAGBfm0QbKZ7usOz1UUpmshH0VzLfB3aKg&amp;nossl=1" href="https://dspace.mah.se/bitstream/handle/2043/16093/Patchwork_Lindstrom_Stahl_2014_korrigerad.pdf?sequence=2&amp;isAllowed=y"><span class="gs_ctg2">[PDF]</span> mah.se</a></div></div></div><div class="gs_ri"><h3 class="gs_rt"><span class="gs_ctc"><span class="gs_ct1">[BOOK]</span><span class="gs_ct2">[B]</span></span> <a data-clk="hl=en&amp;sa=T&amp;ct=res&amp;cd=1&amp;ei=grOYWe3-IoSD2Abotaf4DA&amp;scisig=AAGBfm1BBl-tbrqueBHu0WspGRpauqkmng&amp;nossl=1" href="http://dspace.mah.se/handle/2043/16093">Patchworking publics-in-the-making: design, media and public engagement</a></h3><div class="gs_a"><a href="/citations?user=bfJvrTYAAAAJ&amp;hl=en&amp;oi=sra">K Lindstrm</a>,  Sthl - 2014 - dspace.mah.se</div><div class="gs_rs">This is a collaborative practice-based thesis by publication written across two disciplines: <br/>interaction design, and media and communication studies. electronic music has splintered into numerous genres and subgenres, all of <br/>which share a concern with whether sound, in itself, bears meaning.
